newsitem.title: USA: Bear Stearns establishes bridge loan fund.
newsitem.headline: Bear Stearns establishes bridge loan fund.

text.p: Bear Stearns Cos Inc said Thursday that it has established a $1.5 billion bridge loan fund, exceeding the firm's initial target of $1 billion.
Capital commitments for the fund came from investors including a broad base of banks and financial institutions.
The Mayer Fund, named after one of the firm's founders, Harold Mayer, will provide short-term interim financing to facilitate acquisitions and other financing needs of Bear Stearns' clients.
The bridge loans will be refinanced via the placement of other long term financing.
Bear Stearns said it will be the manager of the fund and has committed to 20 percent of the fund.
